climbs.name: Gap Mtn. SW Ridge II Direct

content.description: Once you are at the base of "Ridge II" the headwall is quite obvious. Blocky double cracks with easy stemming. Gear should be available however it may be relatively wide. Watch for loose rock.
content.protection: Larger gear would probably be helpful.
content.location: At the base of "Ridge II" directly next to fence. The line described here ascends the blocky double cracks which make up the center of the headwall.

content.description: Trying to make this page not confusing and I think that there is potential for more sub-areas in the future so therefore I am adding this one to "Ridge II". This is the portion of the ridge which is next to the train track fence and is truly the start of the ridge. It could host perhaps a few TRs and short leads, and has the generally blocky rock structure. The top of this headwall starts the 4th class portion of the ridge.
